metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8547 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libavcodec/gifdec.c in FFmpeg before 2.4.2 does not properly compute image heights, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted GIF data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libav-tools - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec-extra-54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavdevice-extra-53 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavdevice53 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavfilter-extra-3 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavfilter3 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavformat-extra-54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavformat54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavresample1 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavutil-extra-52 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavutil52 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libswscale-extra-2 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libswscale2 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
